exercise.title: Read Only Domain Controller (RODC)
exercise.name: rdp_rodc
exercise.shortdescription: Enumerate a network using an RODC
exercise.description: Enumerate the network using an RODC
exercise.tutorial:
1. Once you have gained access to a remote workstation, begin data mining user folders on the computer you might find some good information good places to check might be folders under c:\users\public such as downloads, documents, etc.
  2. Check out account details you might have found (what groups he is a member of on the domain), you might notice something interesting (HINT: use the "runas" command) tools: net user, netdom, dsquery, other net commands (see "net help")
    1. Find the Read Only Domain Controller (RODC) in the target's DMZ
  3. If you have done a port scan against the remote DMZ, you might notice a certain port open on the target's RODC that can be used for remote access. Log in with admin credentials through this interface.
  4. Enumerate the domain as a domain admin on the RODC. run a port scan on important infrastructure from the RODC, perhaps the RODC has less restricted firewall rules to certain important machines in the private network than other computers do.

question.text: What did Maveric use too keep up foreign relations?
